item.title: Introduction
item.description: Secure I/O is an open-source project that provides provable secure authenticated encryption for I/O streams. It provides packages for various programming languages and each package exposes an easy-to-use and idiomatic API for encrypting and decrypting I/O operations. However, Secure I/O is not a comprehensive cryptographic library. Instead, it focuses on one specific problem, i.e. encrypting data streams, and solves that in a provable secure way. Take a look at the FAQ to learn more about the limitations of classical encryption schemes.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Why should I use Secure I/O? What does provable secure mean? How can I encrypt data? What's a nonce? Which algorithm should I use?
